intro: Zeuxine parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other similar genera. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. It features delicate, yellowish flowers with five petals and is often found in meadows and forest edges. Its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
